Suicide rates in Japan during the COVID-19 pandemic have been a significant concern, with a notable increase in female suicides compared to the previous year [Source: 1].

In 2020, Japan reported a rise in suicide rates for the first time in 11 years, with a total of 20,919 suicides [Source: 4]. 
The number of suicides among women increased by nearly 15% compared to the previous year, with 6,976 women accounting for this increase [Source: 4].

A notable increase in female suicides was observed in October 2020, with a 70% rise in the suicide rate compared to the same month in the previous year [Source: 1].

The Bond Project, a charity active in suicide prevention, reported that they had intervened in the life of a 19-year-old woman who had attempted suicide multiple times, providing her with a safe place to live and intensive counseling sessions [Source: 1].

The founder of the Bond Project, June Tachibana, stated that the COVID-19 pandemic has pushed vulnerable people to make a fateful decision, with many people experiencing increased mental health issues and feeling isolated and alone [Source: 1].

The pandemic has also affected the mental health of children, adolescents, and women, with a study finding that the incidence of accidents decreased in the first half of 2020 due to factors such as subsidies from the Japanese government, reduced working hours, and school closures [Source: 2].

However, the second wave of the pandemic, which began in the fall, increased the suicide rate by 16% compared to the first wave [Source: 6].

The researchers analyzed data from Japanese social services collected during the first and second waves of the pandemic, as well as for similar time periods between 2016 and 2019 [Source: 6].

The analysis showed that in the first wave, Japanese society reacted to the pandemic in a completely different way than in the second, with suicides decreasing by 14% in the spring of 2020 [Source: 6].

In contrast, the number of suicides increased by 16% in the summer and autumn of the same year [Source: 6].

The increase in female suicides during the pandemic was attributed to various factors, including the impact of the pandemic on industries where many women are employed, such as tourism, retail trade, and the food industry [Source: 5].

Additionally, the pandemic has led to an increase in the number of single women living on their own, with many preferring such a life to marriage, which still assumes traditional gender roles [Source: 5].

The pandemic has also affected the mental health of women, with a study finding that the number of lost jobs among non-permanent workers increased significantly over the past eight months [Source: 5].

Furthermore, the pandemic has led to an increase in domestic violence cases, with a 37% increase in the suicide rate of women who have experienced domestic violence [Source: 2].

The Japanese government has taken steps to address the issue, with Prime Minister Yoshihide Suga appointing a "Minister for Solitude" to address the worsening suicide problem [Source: 4].

The Minister for Solitude, Tetsuji Sakamoto, has established the "Office of Solitude and Isolation Measures" to deal with the serious problem of loneliness and isolation [Source: 4].

The pandemic has also affected the lives of families of suicide victims, with many feeling guilty and unable to mourn their loved ones [Source: 5].

The lack of social interaction and the increased pressure on women to care for their families have contributed to the increase in female suicides during the pandemic [Source: 5].

In conclusion, the COVID-19 pandemic has had a significant impact on suicide rates in Japan, with a notable increase in female suicides compared to the previous year [Source: 1].

The pandemic has affected various factors, including industries where many women are employed, the number of single women living on their own, and the mental health of women [Source: 5].

The Japanese government has taken steps to address the issue, with the appointment of a "Minister for Solitude" and the establishment of the "Office of Solitude and Isolation Measures" [Source: 4].

It is essential to continue monitoring the situation and taking steps to prevent the number of suicides from increasing in the future [Source: 6].

The Palestinian Authority is restoring full relations with Israel, according to PA Civil Administration Minister Hussein al-Sheikh [Source: 1]. 
The Palestinian side will return to compliance with all the agreements that existed on May 19, 2020 [Source: 1]. 


Hamas issued a statement condemning the Palestinian Authority's decision to restore relations with Israel [Source: 1]. 
The statement said that by his decision Ramallah legalizes the process of normalization of relations with Israel [Source: 1]. 


Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas announced the rupture of relations with Israel after the publication of the US-prepared plan for a Palestinian-Israeli settlement - the so-called "deal of the century" [Source: 1].

Cosmetic surgery is a significant focus of medical tourism, with many individuals traveling abroad for various procedures, including cosmetic dental surgery.

According to a comprehensive report on the consumption behavior of new white collar workers in China in 2020, nearly 20% of male white collar workers spend 1131 yuan (about 4863 NT dollars) per month on skin care, which is basically the same as women's 1197 yuan (about 5147 NT dollars) [Source: 1]. 
This growing interest in personal care and beauty treatments has led to an increase in demand for cosmetic surgery and dental services.

In China, the number of medical and aesthetic medical orders on e-commerce platforms during the double 11 period in 2020 increased by nearly seven-fold, with nearly 30% of the orders coming from male consumers [Source: 1]. 
This trend is expected to continue, with the global medical tourism industry projected to grow by 25% per year over the next ten years [Source: 8].

One of the most popular destinations for cosmetic surgery is Turkey, where hair transplantation is a highly sought-after procedure. 
According to the Hurriyet newspaper, in 2017, among 750 thousand tourists, 60 thousand came for hair transplantation, mostly from the Middle East [Source: 8].

Cosmetic dental surgery, including implants, is also a popular destination for medical tourism. 
In Brazil, the most popular procedures are liposuction, abdominoplasty, and buttock augmentation, known as the "Brazilian butt lift" [Source: 8]. 
This trend is also seen in neighboring Colombia, where almost all patients are from the United States, with 50,000 medical tourists visiting the country every year [Source: 8].

The costs of cosmetic surgery and dental services vary significantly depending on the destination. 
In the United States, rhinoplasty can cost an average of $4.8 thousand, while in Thailand, the same procedure can cost as little as $1.6 thousand [Source: 8]. 
In Russia, the cost of hair transplantation can range from 100 thousand rubles to 2 thousand rubles per graft, depending on the clinic and the complexity of the procedure [Source: 8].

Despite the growing demand for cosmetic surgery and dental services, there are also challenges associated with medical tourism. 
One of the main concerns is the lack of regulation and oversight in some countries, which can lead to poor quality care and increased risk of complications [Source: 1].

In addition, the growth of medical tourism has also raised concerns about the impact on local healthcare systems and the potential for exploitation of patients [Source: 1]. 
In some countries, the government has implemented regulations to address these concerns, such as the requirement for medical tourism agencies to be licensed and regulated [Source: 1].

Overall, cosmetic surgery and dental services are a significant focus of medical tourism, with many individuals traveling abroad for various procedures. 
While there are challenges associated with medical tourism, the industry is expected to continue growing in the coming years.

The most popular destinations for cosmetic surgery and dental services include Turkey, Brazil, and Colombia, with the United States also being a popular destination for dental services.

The costs of cosmetic surgery and dental services vary significantly depending on the destination, with Thailand and Brazil offering some of the most competitive prices.

The outcomes of cosmetic surgery and dental services can vary significantly depending on the quality of care and the expertise of the medical professionals.

In conclusion, cosmetic surgery and dental services are a significant focus of medical tourism, with many individuals traveling abroad for various procedures. 
While there are challenges associated with medical tourism, the industry is expected to continue growing in the coming years.

Small "pocket parks" in high-density urban settings have been found to have numerous benefits for fostering more sustainable and resilient cities [Source: 5].

One of the primary benefits of pocket parks is their ability to provide citizens with easy access to green spaces, even in densely populated areas [Source: 5]. 
According to Liu Yuelai, a scholar at Tongji University's School of Architecture and Urban Planning, there is currently no clear definition of the size of a pocket park, but they can be as small as tens of square meters or as large as thousands of square meters [Source: 5].

Pocket parks can also serve as a refuge against the stresses of urban living, providing a peaceful oasis for citizens to relax and recharge [Source: 5]. 
For example, the pocket park in Hongkou District, built after the demolition of illegal buildings, has become a popular spot for residents to take a break from the hustle and bustle of city life [Source: 5].

In addition to providing citizens with access to green spaces, pocket parks can also play a role in promoting physical activity and healthy lifestyles [Source: 5]. 
According to Fang Yan, deputy director of the municipal greening and cityscape administration bureau, the goal of allowing citizens to go out 500 meters to see a 3,000 square meter park green space has been basically achieved [Source: 5].

Pocket parks can also serve as a catalyst for community engagement and social interaction [Source: 3]. 
In the Luhansk region, the creation of a network of sports grounds is part of a larger effort to promote socialization and community involvement [Source: 3]. 
The Luhansk region's innovative portal aims to promote the region and encourage citizens to participate in outdoor activities [Source: 3].

Furthermore, pocket parks can help to mitigate the negative impacts of urbanization on the environment [Source: 4]. 
According to Yahya Sotoudeh Nia, the creation of small parks in urban areas can help to offset the lack of green spaces and provide a refuge for citizens [Source: 4].

In terms of design, pocket parks can be tailored to meet the needs of local communities and provide a range of features and amenities [Source: 5]. 
For example, the pocket park in Cao Jia Street, built in Shanghai, features three leisure seats and small outdoor fitness equipment [Source: 5].

Overall, small "pocket parks" in high-density urban settings offer a range of benefits for fostering more sustainable and resilient cities [Source: 5]. 
By providing citizens with access to green spaces, promoting physical activity and healthy lifestyles, and serving as a catalyst for community engagement and social interaction, pocket parks can play a key role in creating more livable and sustainable urban environments [Source: 5].

The greening of cities is also an important aspect of creating more sustainable and resilient urban environments [Source: 5]. 
According to Fang Yan, the greening department is trying to make more parks around the citizens, even some street gardens and pocket parks, so that people can walk in parks not far from their homes [Source: 5].

In Shanghai, the goal is to create a three-level system of "pocket parks - community parks - regional parks" to provide citizens with access to green spaces [Source: 5]. 
However, the city still has a long way to go in terms of providing adequate green spaces for its residents, with only about 8% of the population having access to public green space [Source: 5].

Overall, the benefits of small "pocket parks" in high-density urban settings are clear, and their design and implementation can play a key role in creating more sustainable and resilient cities [Source: 5].

Turkish soap operas, dramas, and other television series have been used by the Turkish government to exert influence on other countries in which they are viewed [Source: 1].

The Turkish government has been actively involved in promoting its television series globally, with the aim of increasing its soft power and influence [Source: 1]. 
According to Peyman Jebeli, the deputy director of the Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting, the Turkish government has been paying attention to three networks of Russia, China, and Iran, including Press TV [Source: 1].

Press TV has been used as a tool for the Turkish government to promote its views and influence other countries [Source: 1]. 
The channel has been broadcast in several countries, including Iran, Iraq, and Syria [Source: 1].

Turkish television series have been widely popular in the Middle East, with many countries relying on these shows for entertainment and information [Source: 2]. 
The series have been dubbed into Arabic, making them accessible to a wider audience [Source: 2].

The Turkish government has been actively involved in promoting its television series in the Middle East, with the aim of increasing its influence in the region [Source: 2]. 
The government has also been working to promote its cultural and historical heritage through these series [Source: 2].

But all kinds of Jam networks, as well as dozens of others, soon followed the path that Farsi One had taken, and they are still working.  Although the series that are broadcast on these networks is not Iranian, it is interesting to know that Shouder Kerry is produced, which is often shocked by the majority of its events, just like the Iranians.  Many in Turkey say the films don ’ t look anything like ordinary people ’ s lives and aren ’ t even close followers anymore.  We have said this last point to reach the productions of these days of the home screen network in Iran; products that if we are to choose a better name for most of them, we should say the works of the Turkish network!  Because exactly in these series, everything is very different from what happens in ordinary people ’ s lives and at the heart of society.  But the Iranian people are still watching these domestic products in amazement and want to see what will happen at the end of all these events that they will never see around them.  The common components of saying that the majority of the productions of the home show network in the past few years were similar to the Turkish series is a claim that must be explained.  Naturally, all that we see and read in the movies and stories are not real, the writing of the story and the script, although they should be in an atmosphere that communicates with them, but they are not supposed to be true and the imagination of the author is free to carry the story forward.  But the thing is, what happens in del, mannequin, forbidden or other series is supposed to play with the red lines of people ’ s minds and advance their story.  Apart from the fictional aspect of these series, the lifestyle that is seen in these series, the characters of these series are often rich and have a life that is not like the lives of ordinary people.  It ’ s as if all the events of these series are allegedly between the 2 percent of the population and have nothing to do with the other 98 percent.  It is interesting that as much as the face of wealth is exaggerated in these series, the face of poverty is introduced in the same form and shape, and the stories of the prince and the beggar are supposed to be able to sit the people at the feet of the narrative.  But in any case, you can ’ t escape the lifestyle that these serials advertise.  Musical instruments can be seen in the film to the extent that anyone who passes in front of the camera can play the instrument, so much so that we see that the driver of the Snap has taken his harmonica with himself and now that he has accidentally arrived at the sea, he plays for his passenger!  On the other hand, the love stories and their intertwining in these series go so far as to say that the triangle and the square of love can be understood and little terms of their knowledge.  He should have said love!  These multifaceted and extended relationships define family, commitment, friendship, and so on. So much so, that if you look at them, they will be able to see their faces, and they will be able to see their faces, and they will be able to see their faces, and they will be able to see their faces, and they will be able to see their faces.  Even more interesting is that if the time of the series is 90 minutes, in many of them, a large amount of this time refers to the previous events with the voice of a singer and the presence of music, which of course we have written a detailed report on before and we will pass it on.  In short, half the time of the film does not even go to the main line of the story, and if these shows were supposed to have referees like football, they were constantly getting red cards for killing time.  Social subjects serve to entertain the presence of a trans person as the main character or a girl who has been raped and in the culture of our society, or a son who is willing to marry a woman much older than himself to pay off his father ’ s debts, and so on.  They could be subjects that turn the show into a social work, but that doesn ’ t happen.  Social cinema is its job to inform the society of the problems, while trying to solve the problems with solutions and to promote change of approach with behavior, that is, to tell its audience that it can try to solve the problem and have a better tomorrow.  In these series, but there is no news of these roles, they use red lines and specific issues and issues only to attract more audiences and try to entertain their audience, mere entertainment that can be called cultural farce, but it has no positive effect on its audience.  These components, although seen in the commercial cinema of any country, have entered Iran with this volume and breadth after the epidemic of Turkish serials and it seems to be going to be permanent!  Turkey ’ s economic equations in neighboring countries can be seen in the words of Babak Kaidan, the author of the series “Mannequin ” and“ Del ”.  He has said about the similarity of “Mannequin ” with Turkish series:“ If we can build a series like them and become a pole of the cycle of capital that we won a lot and we should be happy, so this is not a problem, and if we forget, they are basically attracting a strong audience and have strengths that we are deceiving ourselves. ”  Serials, of course, play an important role in the economic equations of Turkey, but it is interesting to know that the people of these countries do not appear to be much of the audience of these serials.  Berna Karagozoglu studied in Iran, she has a doctorate in Persian literature, and recently, in an interview with Jam-e Jam, she emphasized that she does not watch Turkish series and is surprised when people ask her about these questions.  He added: “Our people don ’ t see these shows very much because they don ’ t look like their lives.  He stressed that the beautiful houses seen in the shows, the open and free relationships that are being promoted, the love triangles that are constantly being repeated and many other things have no place in the lives of Turkish people.  In addition, if we have the experience of traveling to Turkey or living in this country, we soon realize that the level of life and religious beliefs in the majority of the country ’ s society is different from the image that is displayed in these series, and people go their own way, and these series follow their own path.  The same series, which are not very popular in Turkey, are playing with the cultural identity of their neighbors.  In some surrounding countries, such as Afghanistan and Iraq, the arrangement of houses is determined by the Turkish series, meaning that Turkey sends many of its goods to neighboring countries, goods that previously need to be present in the houses and have customers.  Clothing stores are also controlled by Turkey.  Can the home theater network in Iran, according to Kaidan, create such an atmosphere, and does it even want to break social definitions in Iran and in countries that have much stronger conventional lines than us in many issues and gain economic and profit?  It ’ s a question we all know the answer to …  These non-Iranian Iranian series, just as people watched Persian One series with round eyes a decade and a half ago, have watched similar homegrown productions with rounded eyes since a year or two ago, and then the trend has continued until they get used to watching them and follow them.  Iranian series that are based on exactly the same Turkish series, with the same crises and shortcomings and the same useless attractions.  They don ’ t have stories because they don ’ t have good writers.  Today ’ s writers of home theater networks do not know how to tell stories, so they want to attract audiences by adding sexual elements and showing aristocratic life.  Their stories are not written to generate economic outings in other countries, nor to cure the pain of the people watching them.  This series has an internal address and an internal turnover.  It has internal damage and internal damage.  Their narratives do not resemble the lives of people, they are far from the heart of society, and of course, it can be said that like the adventures of luxury theater and concerts, some people earn money and go for a while.  But what about their cultural impact?  Does it wash away so easily?  And more importantly, are those who give permission to these shows ready to sit down in front of the media one day and give their opinion about them?  Do the honorable directors even look at what they are promoting and what consequences it will have for society when they sign a license?  Source: The End of the Message].

He added: “Our people don ’ t see these shows very much because they don ’ t look like their lives.  He stressed that the beautiful houses seen in the shows, the open and free relationships that are being promoted, the love triangles that are constantly being repeated and many other things have no place in the lives of Turkish people.  In addition, if we have the experience of traveling to Turkey or living in this country, we soon realize that the level of life and religious beliefs in the majority of the country ’ s society is different from the image that is displayed in these series, and people go their own way, and these series follow their own path.  The same series, which are not very popular in Turkey, are playing with the cultural identity of their neighbors.  In some surrounding countries, such as Afghanistan and Iraq, the arrangement of houses is determined by the Turkish series, meaning that Turkey sends many of its goods to neighboring countries, goods that previously need to be present in the houses and have customers.  Clothing stores are also controlled by Turkey.  Can the home theater network in Iran, according to Kaidan, create such an atmosphere, and does it even want to break social definitions in Iran and in countries that have much stronger conventional lines than us in many issues and gain economic and profit?  It ’ s a question we all know the answer to …  These non-Iranian Iranian series, just as people watched Persian One series with round eyes a decade and a half ago, have watched similar homegrown productions with rounded eyes since a year or two ago, and then the trend has continued until they get used to watching them and follow them.  Iranian series that are based on exactly the same Turkish series, with the same crises and shortcomings and the same useless attractions.  They don ’ t have stories because they don ’ t have good writers.  Today ’ s writers of home theater networks do not know how to tell stories, so they want to attract audiences by adding sexual elements and showing aristocratic life.  Their stories are not written to generate economic outings in other countries, nor to cure the pain of the people watching them.  This series has an internal address and an internal turnover.  It has internal damage and internal damage.  Their narratives do not resemble the lives of people, they are far from the heart of society, and of course, it can be said that like the adventures of luxury theater and concerts, some people earn money and go for a while.  But what about their cultural impact?  Does it wash away so easily?  And more importantly, are those who give permission to these shows ready to sit down in front of the media one day and give their opinion about them?  Do the honorable directors even look at what they are promoting and what consequences it will have for society when they sign a license?  Source: The End of the Message].

Creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars is a complex task that requires careful planning and execution. 
One of the key components of a sustainable atmosphere is the production of oxygen, which is essential for human life support [Source: 1].

NASA's Mars rover, Perseverance, has successfully demonstrated the ability to extract oxygen from the Martian atmosphere using the Mars Oxygen In-situ Resource Utilization Experiment (MOXIE) [Source: 1]. 
MOXIE is a toaster-sized instrument that converts carbon dioxide into oxygen and carbon monoxide [Source: 7]. 
The experiment was conducted on April 20, the 60th day since the landing of the mission to Mars [Source: 1].

The MOXIE device uses electrolysis to break down carbon dioxide into oxygen and carbon monoxide [Source: 7]. 
The process involves capturing carbon dioxide, passing it through a filter to remove dust, and then compressing it to provide pressure at ground level [Source: 7]. 
The gas then passes through a heated electrolysis cell, which consists of several layers of nickel alloy and ceramics [Source: 7].

The MOXIE technology has the potential to provide astronauts with oxygen for breathing and fuel for rocket propulsion [Source: 7]. 
The device is capable of producing up to 10 grams of oxygen per hour, which is a significant improvement over previous oxygen-generating experiments [Source: 7].

However, creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars is not just about producing oxygen. 
It also requires the production of other essential resources, such as water and food [Source: 8]. 
NASA is working on developing technologies to extract water from Martian soil and ice [Source: 8]. 
The agency is also exploring ways to produce food on Mars using hydroponics and aeroponics [Source: 8].

In terms of worst-case scenarios, NASA engineers are planning for the possibility of equipment failure and power outages [Source: 9]. 
The agency is also preparing for the possibility of contamination by Earth-based microorganisms [Source: 10]. 
However, researchers believe that sending Earth microbes to Mars could be beneficial for creating a habitable environment [Source: 9].

The largest number of people that could be sustained by the atmosphere on Mars is not yet known. 
However, NASA engineers are planning for a sustainable atmosphere that could support a team of up to 250,000 people [Source: 2]. 
The agency is working on developing technologies to extract resources from Martian soil and ice, which could support a large population [Source: 2].

In terms of incorporating local materials, NASA's MOXIE experiment uses the Martian atmosphere as a source of carbon dioxide [Source: 1]. 
The experiment also uses Martian regolith, a mixture of minerals created on Mars, to simulate the planet's surface conditions [Source: 10]. 
However, the use of local materials is still in its infancy, and more research is needed to develop sustainable technologies for creating a habitable environment on Mars [Source: 10].

In conclusion, creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars requires careful planning and execution. 
NASA's MOXIE experiment has demonstrated the ability to extract oxygen from the Martian atmosphere, but more research is needed to develop sustainable technologies for creating a habitable environment. 
The agency is working on developing technologies to extract resources from Martian soil and ice, which could support a large population. 
However, the largest number of people that could be sustained by the atmosphere on Mars is not yet known.

The use of local materials, such as the Martian atmosphere and regolith, is an important step towards creating a sustainable environment on Mars. 
However, more research is needed to develop technologies that can harness these resources efficiently.

The agency is also exploring ways to produce food on Mars using hydroponics and aeroponics.

Overall, creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars is a complex task that requires careful planning and execution.

Bayer, a German chemical and pharmaceutical company, has been facing numerous lawsuits in the United States related to its Roundup herbicide, which has been accused of causing cancer [Source: 1].

The lawsuits have resulted in tens of thousands of claims, with plaintiffs alleging that exposure to Roundup has led to the development of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and other cancers [Source: 2]. 
In an effort to settle these claims, Bayer has reached an agreement with plaintiffs' lawyers to pay approximately $10.5 billion [Source: 1].

As part of this agreement, Bayer will pay about $9.5 billion to settle claims filed by lawyers representing some 95,000 plaintiffs [Source: 1]. 
The company will also set aside an additional $1.1 billion to establish and fund a panel to assess whether the product causes cancer, with the goal of influencing the outcome of future litigation [Source: 1].

Bayer's offer to settle the claims was initially reported to be around $8 billion, but the company ultimately agreed to pay $10.5 billion to settle the claims [Source: 2]. 
The settlement is a significant milestone for the company, which has been facing declining share prices and shareholder dissatisfaction due to the ongoing lawsuits [Source: 1].

The Roundup herbicide was previously owned by Monsanto, which was acquired by Bayer in a $63 billion deal [Source: 2]. 
As a result of the acquisition, Bayer is now responsible for defending the company against lawsuits related to the herbicide [Source: 2].

In addition to the financial settlement, the agreement also includes provisions for Bayer to establish a panel to assess the safety of the product and to provide compensation to affected individuals [Source: 1]. 
The panel will be responsible for reviewing the scientific evidence related to the safety of Roundup and providing recommendations for future litigation [Source: 1].

The settlement is a significant development in the ongoing litigation related to Roundup, and it is likely to have a major impact on the company's financial performance and reputation [Source: 1]. 
The agreement demonstrates Bayer's commitment to resolving the claims and providing compensation to affected individuals, and it is a major step towards resolving the ongoing litigation [Source: 1].

The Gustav Klimt painting, "Portrait of a Lady," was lost in 1997 from the Ricci Oddi Modern Art Gallery in Piacenza, Italy [Source: 4]. 
The painting was stolen a month before the opening of an exhibition dedicated to the famous Austrian artist [Source: 1].

The painting was considered stolen for 22 years, and its disappearance was not immediately noticed by the curators, who did not see the canvas since Tuesday, but reported to the police only on Saturday [Source: 6]. 
A frame of the painting was found on the roof of the museum, leading to the version that the picture was pulled out with a fishing rod through a window in the ceiling [Source: 6].

However, the canvas itself was not found until December 10, 2019, when an employee of one of the municipal enterprises of Piacenza cleaned the walls of the Ricci Oddi gallery from ivy [Source: 5]. 
The employee found a cavity in the wall closed by an iron door, and inside lay a painting wrapped in a black plastic garbage bag [Source: 5].

The painting was identified as "Portrait of a Woman" by Gustav Klimt, which was stolen from the gallery in 1997 [Source: 4]. 
The painting was valued at 60 million euros [Source: 4].

Experts confirmed the authenticity of the painting, stating that the research lasted a month since the discovery, and experts appointed by the Prosecutor's office confirmed the authenticity of the picture [Source: 2]. 
The representative of the police added that now other experts will work with the canvas to look for fingerprints and other evidence that may shed light on her disappearance [Source: 2].

The painting was found in a niche behind a partition in a black bag hidden by thick vegetation [Source: 3]. 
The painting was found in the wall of the gallery of contemporary art Ricci Oddi in Piacenza, from where it disappeared [Source: 1].

The painting was found to be in excellent condition, with no signs of aging or damage [Source: 7]. 
The head of the Department of Culture of the City of Piacenza, Jonathan Papamareng, questioned the version that the thieves planned to return for the canvas of Klimt, but failed to do so due to increased security measures in the gallery of Ricci Oddi [Source: 7].

The painting is believed to have been hidden in the wall for 22 years, close to the ground and plants [Source: 7]. 
The gardener who found the painting estimated that the painting had been in the same place since 1997 [Source: 1].

The painting is valued at $66 million [Source: 8].

Climate change has significant impacts on agriculture worldwide [Source: 1]. 
Rising temperatures and changing rainfall patterns affect crop yields, while increased carbon dioxide levels can lead to changes in plant growth and productivity [Source: 1].

Crop yields are expected to decrease due to rising temperatures, which can lead to reduced nutritional values in staple crops such as rice, wheat, barley, and potatoes [Source: 1]. 
The report estimates that the protein content in these crops can be reduced by 6% to 14% [Source: 1]. 
This can lead to an increase in the number of people at risk of protein deficiency, with nearly 150 million more people affected than today [Source: 1].

Climate change also affects the distribution of water resources, leading to droughts and water scarcity in some regions [Source: 3]. 
In Kazakhstan, the reduction of water resources is predicted to be 25% by 2030 [Source: 3]. 
This can have significant impacts on agricultural productivity and food security.

The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) estimates that 80 million more people will be at risk of hunger by 2050 than today [Source: 1]. 
This is due to a combination of factors, including changes in temperature and rainfall patterns, and increased competition for water resources.

In India, up to 40% of rice-producing areas are feared to be unsuitable for farming due to climate change [Source: 1]. 
This can lead to reduced crop yields and increased food prices, making it difficult for low-income households to access nutritious food.

Climate change can also lead to the displacement of people, with studies estimating that between 30 million and 140 million people will be displaced in Africa, Southeast Asia, and Latin America by 2050 [Source: 2]. 
This can have significant social and economic impacts, particularly for vulnerable communities.

In addition to these impacts, climate change can also lead to the loss of biodiversity, with many plant and animal species facing extinction due to changing environmental conditions [Source: 4]. 
This can have significant impacts on ecosystem services, including pollination, pest control, and nutrient cycling.

The IPCC report emphasizes the need for urgent action to address the impacts of climate change on agriculture and food security [Source: 1]. 
This includes promoting sustainable agricultural practices, such as agroforestry and conservation agriculture, and supporting climate-resilient agriculture through research and development.

Overall, climate change has significant impacts on agriculture, food security, and human health. 
It is essential to address these impacts through sustainable agricultural practices, climate-resilient agriculture, and support for vulnerable communities.

Climate change can affect the productivity of crops, with some crops being more resilient to temperature changes than others [Source: 4]. 
However, many crops are sensitive to temperature changes, and can experience reduced yields or changed growth patterns.

The IPCC report estimates that global agricultural productivity has declined by 21% since 1961, due to climate-related factors [Source: 7]. 
This decline is expected to continue, with some regions experiencing more significant declines than others.

Climate change can also lead to changes in the distribution of pests and diseases, which can impact crop yields and food security [Source: 4]. 
For example, the spread of the Asian tiger mosquito, which can transmit diseases such as dengue fever and chikungunya, is expected to increase in some regions due to climate change [Source: 4].

In addition to these impacts, climate change can also lead to changes in the availability of water resources, which can impact agricultural productivity and food security [Source: 3].

The Golden Bear award at the Berlin International Film Festival is one of the most prestigious awards in the film industry [Source: 1]. 
Iranian filmmaker Mohammad Rasoulof's film "Evil Does Not Exist" won the Golden Bear award in 2020 [Source: 4]. 
The film is about the lack of freedom of intimate life in a totalitarian society [Source: 1].

The film "Evil Does Not Exist" is directed by Mohammad Rasoulof, who is known for raising repression and repression in Iran in his films [Source: 5]. 
Rasoulof was sentenced to one year in prison and two years ban from leaving the country in late July 2019 on charges of "propaganda against the Islamic system" [Source: 5]. 
Despite this, he was able to win the Golden Bear award for his film [Source: 5].

The film "Evil Does Not Exist" tells the story of several men who are forced to defend their freedom to one degree or another [Source: 6]. 
The jury of the Berlin Film Festival, headed by British actor Jeremy Irons, did not leave without an award and the most scandalous film of the film review - the Russian project DAU. 
NATASHA directed by Ilya Khrzhanovsky [Source: 6].

The film "Evil Does Not Exist" was produced by Mohammad Rasoulof, Kaveh Farnam, and Farzad Pakpak [Source: 4]. 
The film received the Golden Bear Award, which is the main prize of the Berlin Film Festival [Source: 4]. 
The award was presented by Baran Rasoulof, the film's producer and daughter of Mohammad Rasoulof [Source: 5].

The Berlin International Film Festival is an annual international film festival held in Berlin since 1951 [Source: 2]. 
The main prize is the Golden Bear, which is the heraldic symbol of Berlin [Source: 2]. 
The festival gave out awards, giving the main prize to the Iranian picture EVIL DOES NOT EXIST [Source: 6].

The film "Evil Does Not Exist" was not the only Iranian film to participate in the festival. 
Iranian filmmaker Sohrab Shahid-Sales previously received the Silver Bear and Golden Bear at the Berlin Film Festival for Dead Nature and Nader and Simin's Divorce in 1974 and 2011, respectively [Source: 3]. 
The film "Yalda" directed by Masud Bakhshi participates in the category "Generation 14plus" [Source: 3]. 
The Iranian short films “Kites ” by Payam Hosseini and“ Winged White Horse ” by Mahyar Mandegar will also participate in the same category [Source: 3].

The film "Evil Does Not Exist" received the Golden Bear Award for Best Berlinale Film 2020 [Source: 7]. 
The jury of the Berlin Film Festival announced the winners in the main categories on February 29, 2020 [Source: 7]. 
The list of winners is published on the festival website [Source: 7].

The film "Evil Does Not Exist" was not the only film to receive awards at the festival. 
The Grand Prix of the festival went to the American-British drama NEVER, RARE, SOMETIMES, ALWAYS Eliza Hittman [Source: 6]. 
The film "The Woman Who ran away" directed by Hong Sang-soo received the Silver Bear Award for Best Director [Source: 6]. 
The best actor was Elio Germano, who played the role in the film "I wanted to hide" [Source: 6]. 
The best actress was Paula Beer, who played the main role in the film "Undine" [Source: 6].

The English Channel has become a major route for refugees and asylum seekers attempting to reach the United Kingdom, with a significant increase in the number of people attempting to cross the channel by small, unsafe boats in recent years [Source: 1].

According to data from PA Media, more than 7,400 people reached the UK via the English Channel in small boats this year, nearly four times more than in 2019 [Source: 1]. 
This year's "record" was set with the arrival of 416 refugees on September 2 [Source: 1].

The majority of those attempting to cross the channel are from Iran, with over 4,000 refugees applying for asylum in the UK this year, making up 12% of all asylum seekers [Source: 8]. 
Other nationalities represented among those attempting to cross the channel include Afghans, Libyans, and Bangladeshis [Source: 5].

The casualty rate among those attempting to cross the channel is alarming, with many reported deaths and injuries [Source: 3]. 
In one recent incident, four people, including two children, drowned in the English Channel while attempting to reach Britain [Source: 3]. 
In another incident, 73 refugees from Bangladesh almost drowned trying to reach the Italian island of Lampedusa [Source: 2].

If those who successfully reach the British side of the channel are detected, they are typically detained by the authorities and their asylum applications are processed [Source: 8]. 
However, the process can be lengthy, with many applicants waiting for over six months for their applications to be processed [Source: 8].

In response to the growing number of refugees attempting to cross the channel, France and the UK have taken steps to crack down on smuggling and human trafficking [Source: 9]. 
The UK has increased the number of staff on its coast guard vessels and has deployed the Royal Navy and Air Force to intercept smugglers [Source: 9]. 
France has also stepped up its efforts to combat smuggling, with the French Coast Guard and naval authorities working together to intercept and rescue migrants [Source: 5].

In addition, the UK has introduced new measures to deter asylum seekers from attempting to cross the channel, including a plan to process asylum claims based on the route migrants took to reach the country [Source: 7]. 
This plan, which was unveiled by the UK's Interior Minister, Priti Patel, aims to make it harder for asylum seekers to claim asylum in the UK [Source: 7].

The Stratolaunch, the world's largest aircraft to date, is a twin-body six-engine aircraft designed by Stratolaunch Systems [Source: 1]. 
The aircraft has a wingspan of 117 meters [Source: 3] and a length of 72.5 meters [Source: 3]. 
It is equipped with six twin-circuit Pratt & Whitney PW4056 turbojet engines [Source: 6], which were removed from two decommissioned Boeing 747-400 aircraft [Source: 6]. 
The aircraft has two fuselages, one for crew members and the other for navigation systems, flight systems, and other aviation electronics [Source: 1]. 
The fuselages are connected by a reinforced wing, which serves as a mounting point for the rocket that will rise to the height of its launch [Source: 1].

The Stratolaunch aircraft has a maximum take-off weight of 589.7 tons [Source: 6] and a suspended payload weight of 230 tons [Source: 3]. 
The aircraft is designed to launch space launch vehicles using the "air launch" method, which will be carried out from an altitude of approximately 10,500 meters [Source: 6]. 
The Stratolaunch aircraft is the largest aircraft in history, having a wingspan that exceeds the former largest aircraft in the world, the Soviet An-225 "Mriya" [Source: 6].

The Stratolaunch aircraft began running in December last year [Source: 3] and a fully assembled airframe was tested in February of this year, during which the aircraft developed a speed of 40 knots (74 kilometers per hour) [Source: 3]. 
The latest tests of the Stratolaunch aircraft were carried out on Saturday and Sunday in the Mojave Air & Space Port in California, where the aircraft was allowed to accelerate to a speed of 75 kilometers per hour [Source: 1]. 
The suspension, brake system, and a number of other related technologies were tested during these tests [Source: 1].

The Stratolaunch aircraft made its first flight on May 31, 2017, from an airport near Los Angeles [Source: 7]. 
The aircraft took off from an airfield in the Mojave Desert in California, south of Los Angeles [Source: 5]. 
The first flight of the Stratolaunch aircraft lasted 2.5 hours [Source: 4] and the aircraft developed a maximum speed of 304 km/h [Source: 4]. 
The test flight also reached an altitude of over 5 km [Source: 4].

The Stratolaunch aircraft is designed to carry a payload weighing 249.5 tons [Source: 3]. 
The aircraft is equipped with six Boeing 747 engines, which provide a thrust of 25 tons [Source: 6]. 
The Stratolaunch aircraft is designed to launch small rockets, which will be carried out from an altitude of approximately 10,500 meters [Source: 6]. 
The launch vehicle should be suspended under the central part of the wing between the fuselages [Source: 6].

The Stratolaunch aircraft is expected to be used as an air launch platform, carrying small rockets to bring the payload to low Earth orbit [Source: 3]. 
The aircraft's first demonstration flight is planned to take place in 2019 [Source: 3]. 
The Stratolaunch aircraft is expected to be used to launch payloads weighing up to 230 tons into low Earth orbit using conventional runways [Source: 1].

Deliberate Derailment of Cyclists During the Tour de France: An Investigation\n

On June 26, 2021, the 2021 Tour de France began in Brest, France, with 23 teams participating in the 197.8-kilometer race [Source: 1]. 
However, the event was marred by two serious car accidents, one of which was caused by a spectator who deliberately derailed several cyclists [Source: 1].

The first incident occurred 45 kilometers away from the finish line, when a woman wearing a bright yellow coat and holding up sunglasses stood beside the track with a card written on the cheering words, apparently facing the live camera [Source: 1]. 
The card read "allez opi omi" in French and German, meaning to say hello to grandparents [Source: 3]. 
The woman's position and the cards in her hands were clearly too close to the track, and she did not notice the approaching cyclists [Source: 1].

As the main train group arrived, German driver Tony Martin hit the card and fell to the ground, becoming the beginning of a series of chaos [Source: 1]. 
The selfishness of the woman in yellow not only caused two hot spots for the championship but also caused nine drivers to injure, including German driver Jasha Suetterlin, who had to retire and was unable to compete in the second leg [Source: 1].

The incident was not an isolated case, as another accident occurred 8 kilometers from the end, due to the accident on the high-speed section, up to 12 people were injured, and the injury is also serious [Source: 2]. 
The famous Chris Froome will withdraw, Swiss driver Marc Hirschi also suffered a serious shoulder injury, his UAE team mate, last Tour de France champion Tadej Pogacar, even though he finished sixth, he still looked sad: “Today was not good at all, there were a lot of accidents, and my teammates were not in very good condition” [Source: 2].

The woman who caused the car to be fried immediately fled and disappeared [Source: 1]. 
Pierre-Yves Thouault, the deputy director of the Tour de France, will go to the end: “We will prosecute this woman who has behaved badly, and only by doing so can we deter that little bad person” [Source: 1].

An investigation was initiated by the gendarmerie of the French Finistère, and the woman was wanted for charges of “clearly and deliberately violating the duty of care and accidentally causing short-term harm” [Source: 4]. 
The organizers of the Tour de France have also promised to take legal action against the woman, saying that "we are suing this woman who has behaved so badly, and we are doing this so that the few who have done so will not spoil the events of others" [Source: 7].

The incident was not a one-time occurrence, as there were other incidents during the event, including a blockage caused by a fan who held up a sign and stood very close to the roadway [Source: 8]. 
The fan, who was later arrested, was accused of causing a domino effect, and several cyclists collided with each other, creating a rather serious collision [Source: 8].

The incident highlights the importance of road safety and the need for spectators to be aware of their surroundings, especially during high-speed events like the Tour de France [Source: 9]. 
The organizers of the event have promised to take measures to prevent such incidents in the future, including increasing security and reminding fans to stay on the side of the road [Source: 9].

In conclusion, the deliberate derailment of cyclists during the Tour de France was a serious incident that caused injuries and disruption to the event. 
The incident highlights the need for spectators to be aware of their surroundings and to respect the safety of the athletes [Source: 1]. 
The organizers of the event have promised to take measures to prevent such incidents in the future, and the woman who caused the incident will face charges for her actions [Source: 4].

The Crew Dragon Demo-2 mission, launched by SpaceX on May 30, 2020, marked a significant milestone in the history of space exploration [Source: 1]. 
This mission was the first manned mission launched from the United States since 2011, when NASA retired its fleet of space shuttles [Source: 1]. 
The Demo-2 mission was also the world's first commercial mission, where a spacecraft with astronauts on board was put into orbit [Source: 1].

The successful launch of the Crew Dragon spacecraft, carrying two astronauts, Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley, into space, demonstrated the capabilities of private space companies in space exploration [Source: 2]. 
The mission was a result of a contract between SpaceX and NASA, with a value of $2.6 billion [Source: 3].

The Demo-2 mission was a crucial step towards establishing commercial space travel, paving the way for regular flights to the International Space Station (ISS) [Source: 1]. 
The success of this mission would enable SpaceX to begin carrying out regular flights to the ISS, delivering astronauts and various cargoes back to Earth [Source: 1].

The launch of the Crew Dragon spacecraft was a historic event, marking the first orbital space flight launched from the United States since 2011 [Source: 4]. 
The mission was also a significant milestone for SpaceX, as it demonstrated the reliability of its Crew Dragon spacecraft and its ability to carry out complex space missions [Source: 5].

The Demo-2 mission was a result of years of development and testing by SpaceX, which had been working towards establishing commercial space travel since 2012 [Source: 5]. 
The mission was a culmination of the company's efforts to develop a reusable spacecraft capable of carrying astronauts to the ISS [Source: 5].

The success of the Demo-2 mission has opened up new opportunities for the global space program, as stated by the Executive Director of Roscosmos, Sergey Krikalev [Source: 2]. 
Krikalev welcomed the launch of the Crew Dragon spacecraft, noting that the success of the mission would give the world additional opportunities for the development of manned flights in the ISS program [Source: 2].

The Demo-2 mission has also marked a new chapter in American space exploration, as stated by NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine [Source: 3]. 
Bridenstine noted that the successful launch marked a new era in American spaceflight, bringing the country closer to carrying American astronauts from American soil on American rockets [Source: 3].

The Crew Dragon spacecraft is equipped with two types of propulsion systems, low and high pressure, which are designed to perform orbital maneuvers and controlled landing in case of an emergency [Source: 5]. 
The spacecraft also features a rescue system, which was tested during the Demo-2 mission, demonstrating its ability to protect astronauts in the unlikely event of an emergency [Source: 5].

The Demo-2 mission has paved the way for future commercial space travel, as SpaceX plans to begin providing communication services to its first customers in 2020 and full network deployment is scheduled for the mid-2020s [Source: 5]. 
The company also plans to make 35 to 38 launches in 2020, with at least 24 of those launches being part of the Starlink project [Source: 5].

The Canadian court has ruled that the shooting down of Ukrainian International Airlines flight PS 752 by Iranian forces was a deliberate "terrorist act" [Source: 1].

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice in Canada determined that the plane was hit by two missiles shortly after take-off in Tehran, as a result of a "deliberate" act [Source: 2].

North Korea detained a Russian fishing ship in 2019 due to the alleged illegal crossing of the border of the military protection zone, which the DPRK arbitrarily established 50 miles from the shore.

The fishing ship, Xianghaylin-8, was a Russian vessel carrying 15 Russian citizens and two South Korean crew members, who were traveling from the South Korean port of Sokcho to the Sea of Japan for fishing [Source: 2]. 
The incident occurred on the night of July 17, within 55 nautical miles of North Korean territory [Source: 2].

At 4 a.m. 
on July 17, the border guards went to the ship and turned off all communication devices [Source: 2]. 
The crew did not realize what had happened at first, thinking that the border guards had left, but soon realized they had been seized [Source: 2].

The sailors were escorted to the North Korean port of Wonsan, where they were held [Source: 3]. 
The Russian Consulate General was only able to visit the passengers on Tuesday, July 23 [Source: 2].

The detention occurred in the Sea of Japan, where the fishing vessel was engaged in crab mining [Source: 3]. 
The company that owns the vessel, the Northeast Fishing Company, stated that they had not violated any regulations [Source: 4].

The North Korean authorities indicated that the reason for the arrest was the illegal crossing of the border of the military protection zone [Source: 3]. 
However, the company disputed this claim, stating that the ship had not violated any regulations [Source: 4].

The detained sailors were interrogated and searched twice a day, and were being held in closed cabins [Source: 2]. 
The Russian Consulate General was only able to visit the passengers on Tuesday, July 23 [Source: 2].

The incident occurred before the end of July 2019, as the Russian fishing boat was released on July 28, 2019 [Source: 4]. 
The boat had been detained for 10 days before being released [Source: 4].

Japan has started hunting whales again due to several reasons.

The country officially withdrew from the International Whaling Commission (IWC) on Sunday, June 30, after 32 years to restart commercial whaling [Source: 8]. 
This decision was made after Japan's Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, Takayama Yoshikawa, said that the resumption of whaling was the "sad wish of the people involved in the national whaling" [Source: 1].

One of the main reasons for Japan's decision to resume whaling is to revitalize the economy [Source: 8]. 
Some areas that used to make a living from whaling also hope to revitalize the economy by restarting whale hunting, such as the Amikawa area in the east of Miyagi Prefecture, which was the base of the whaling port of that year [Source: 8].

Whale meat is quite nutritious and has become an important food item for the Japanese since the end of World War II [Source: 8]. 
However, the annual consumption of whale meat in Japan since the 1990s has been about 2,000 to 6,000 tons, and the latest figure in 2018 totals 3,000 tons [Source: 8].

The resumption of commercial whaling is also seen as a way to maintain the existence of the whaling industry [Source: 5]. 
The Japanese government is doing this mainly out of domestic political considerations [Source: 5]. 
For example, Japan's current prime minister, Shinzo Abe, was born in Yamaguchi Prefecture, a whaling prefecture [Source: 5].

Whaling has been a part of Japan's culture for centuries, and the country has a long history of whaling, which began in prehistoric times [Source: 8]. 
In the Edo period, whaling gradually became an industry [Source: 8]. 
Various parts of the whale were fully utilized, such as whale oil as a pesticide, bone nata as carving, and ambergris as a perfume [Source: 8].

The resumption of commercial whaling is also seen as a way to gain the support of local residents [Source: 5]. 
The constituency of the former president of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party's faction, the "Chi Shih Association", is a land of whaling [Source: 5].

However, the actual market demand for whale meat is not high [Source: 8]. 
The price of whale meat is not particularly expensive due to the low supply and demand [Source: 8]. 
In the Tokyo market price in 2018, the price of "red meat level 1" whale meat used for sashimi is 1,600 yen (about HK $110) per kilogram, and the price of "umu" whale meat used for high-grade smoked is 3,000 yen (about HK $210) per kilogram [Source: 8].

The resumption of commercial whaling has also been criticized by international environmental groups [Source: 8]. 
The World Health Organization (WHO) has warned people that high levels of mercury in dolphin meat can cause diseases such as cancer, infertility, and suppression of the immune system [Source: 8].

In addition, Japan's Small Whaling Association President Yoshinori Abe called the news of the resumption of commercial whaling "a shock of joy and a sense of limitlessness" [Source: 8]. 
Prosperity again [Source: 8].

The country plans to resume commercial whaling only off the coast of Japan [Source: 1]. 
However, the three species of whales that are targeted for commercial whaling, minke whales, sei whales, and cloth whales, are still listed as threatened with extinction [Source: 6].

The resumption of commercial whaling has also been criticized by conservation groups and other foreign media [Source: 1]. 
The International Whaling Commission was established in 1948 to focus on whale conservation around the world [Source: 6]. 
Japan has a long tradition of whaling since the Edo period and is the world's largest consumer of whales [Source: 1].

Ernest Hemingway was a renowned American writer, known for his distinctive writing style that has been widely acclaimed for its simplicity, clarity, and concision.

Hemingway's writing style is characterized by its ability to convey complex ideas and emotions through a limited use of words, as he once said, "In creativity it is necessary to tear, go to the depth, to the width, to destroy" [Source: 1]. 
This approach has been praised for its ability to create a sense of intimacy and immediacy with the reader.

Many critics have noted that Hemingway's writing style is marked by its use of simple, direct language, which allows the reader to focus on the essential elements of the story. 
As one critic noted, "Hemingway's prose is like a scalpel - it cuts to the heart of the matter, leaving out all the unnecessary words" [Source: 2].

Hemingway's writing style has also been praised for its ability to evoke a sense of time and place. 
His use of descriptive language, such as his vivid descriptions of the natural world, has been noted for its ability to transport the reader to a different time and place.

In addition to his literary style, Hemingway was also known for his ability to convey complex emotions and ideas through his writing. 
As one critic noted, "Hemingway's writing is like a mirror - it reflects the deepest desires and fears of the human heart" [Source: 3].

Hemingway's writing style has been compared to that of other great writers, such as Fyodor Dostoevsky and Leo Tolstoy. 
However, Hemingway's unique approach to writing has been praised for its ability to create a sense of universality and timelessness.

In his own words, Hemingway described his writing style as "the iceberg theory", where only a small part of the story is visible above the surface, while the rest is hidden beneath [Source: 4]. 
This approach has been praised for its ability to create a sense of mystery and intrigue.

Overall, Hemingway's writing style is characterized by its simplicity, clarity, and concision, making it one of the most distinctive and influential writing styles of the 20th century.

Hemingway's writing style has been widely studied and admired, and his influence can be seen in many other writers and artists.

In conclusion, Hemingway's writing style is a unique and powerful tool for conveying complex ideas and emotions, and his influence can still be felt today.

Small "pocket parks" have been found to provide numerous benefits in high-density urban settings, contributing to the development of more sustainable and resilient cities [Source: 8].

One of the primary advantages of pocket parks is their ability to provide citizens with accessible green spaces, which can help to mitigate the negative effects of urbanization and improve overall quality of life [Source: 8]. 
According to Liu Yuelai, a scholar at Tongji University's School of Architecture and Urban Planning, there is currently no clear definition of the size of pocket parks, but they can range from tens of square meters to thousands of square meters [Source: 8].

Pocket parks also offer a range of recreational and social benefits, including opportunities for walking, chatting, and fitness [Source: 8]. 
In addition, they can serve as community hubs, fostering social connections and a sense of community among residents [Source: 8]. 
According to Fang Yan, deputy director of the municipal greening and cityscape administration bureau, the greening department is trying to make more parks around the citizens, even some street gardens and pocket parks, so that people can walk in parks not far from their homes [Source: 8].

The design of pocket parks can also play a crucial role in their effectiveness. 
According to Adam, head of the landscape consulting firm, the original idea of all of this design came from his childhood, and the use of natural materials such as wood, sand, and soil can create a welcoming and inviting atmosphere [Source: 8].

Furthermore, pocket parks can contribute to the development of more sustainable and resilient cities by providing green spaces that can help to mitigate the effects of urban heat island effects, improve air quality, and reduce the urban footprint [Source: 7]. 
In Shanghai, for example, the goal of allowing citizens to go out 500 meters to see a 3,000 square meter park green space has been basically achieved, and the city is planning to build or upgrade 50 pocket parks this year [Source: 8].

In terms of features, pocket parks can include a range of amenities such as fitness equipment, seating areas, and walking paths [Source: 8]. 
They can also be designed to incorporate natural elements, such as trees, flowers, and wildlife habitats [Source: 8]. 
According to Yahya Sotoudeh Nia, creating very small or pocket parks is a solution to offset part of the lack of green spaces in urban centers, residential complexes, and other areas of the city [Source: 7].

Overall, pocket parks offer a range of benefits that can contribute to the development of more sustainable and resilient cities. 
By providing accessible green spaces, recreational and social opportunities, and sustainable design elements, pocket parks can play an important role in improving the quality of life for urban residents [Source: 8].

Creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars requires careful planning and consideration of various factors, including the equipment needed, worst-case scenarios, and the largest number of people that can be sustained by the atmosphere.

To create a sustainable atmosphere on Mars, it is essential to use local materials whenever possible. 
One such example is the use of cyanobacteria, which can thrive in Martian atmospheric conditions and provide a source of carbon and oxygen [Source: 20]. 
These microorganisms can be grown in a bioreactor, such as the Atmos bioreactor developed by researchers at the University of Bremen in Germany [Source: 26]. 
The bioreactor maintains atmospheric pressure at 10 percent of Earth's and nitrogen and carbon dioxide concentrations of 96 percent and 4 percent, respectively [Source: 26]. 
Water and a mixture of minerals mimicking Martian regolith were also added to the bioreactor [Source: 26].

Another example of local materials used in creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars is the use of Martian dust, which can be used to feed other living organisms [Source: 20]. 
Cyanobacteria, such as Anabaena sp. 
PCC 7938, can multiply in water with a suspension of Martian dust [Source: 26]. 
These microorganisms can support life by using the gases of the Martian atmosphere as a source of carbon and oxygen, despite the low pressure [Source: 26].

In addition to using local materials, it is also essential to consider the worst-case scenarios that may arise when creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars. 
One such scenario is the potential for a sudden loss of oxygen, which could have severe consequences for the health and well-being of the colonists [Source: 24]. 
To mitigate this risk, it is essential to have a backup system in place, such as a device that can produce oxygen from the Martian atmosphere [Source: 19].

NASA's oxygen-generating experiment on Mars, known as MOXIE, is a prime example of a device that can produce oxygen from the Martian atmosphere [Source: 19]. 
MOXIE uses extreme heat to separate oxygen atoms from carbon dioxide molecules through electrolysis [Source: 19]. 
The device is the size of a conventional toaster and can produce up to 10 grams of oxygen per hour [Source: 19]. 
MOXIE was successfully tested on April 20, and the results showed that the device can produce oxygen from the Martian atmosphere [Source: 19].

The largest number of people that can be sustained by the atmosphere on Mars is a topic of ongoing research and debate. 
However, one estimate suggests that a population of 100,000 people could be sustained by a self-sufficient ecosystem on Mars [Source: 10]. 
This estimate is based on the idea that a large enough population would be able to produce its own food, water, and energy, reducing the need for external resources [Source: 10].

In conclusion, creating a sustainable atmosphere on Mars requires careful planning and consideration of various factors, including the equipment needed, worst-case scenarios, and the largest number of people that can be sustained by the atmosphere. 
Using local materials, such as cyanobacteria and Martian dust, can help to create a sustainable ecosystem on Mars. 
NASA's oxygen-generating experiment on Mars, known as MOXIE, is a prime example of a device that can produce oxygen from the Martian atmosphere.

[While human-made robotic creations explore Mars for signs of ancient life and to examine and test living conditions, plans for human habitation on Mars are taking on new dimensions.  A company called ABIBOO recently unveiled its plan to build the first Martian city.  The architecture firm Abybo has completed its plan to build the first Martian city.  The first large Martian town, called Nüwa City, can accommodate 250,000 people and will be built along and inside a massive rock.  Where people will have access to sunlight without being exposed to the risk of deadly cosmic radiation.  The Martian city ’ s massive lunar and Martian corridors, a suitable place for human habitation, could begin construction by 2054, and its first potential settlers are likely to move there by 2100.  As seen in the city ’ s renderings, the interiors of Noah ’ s luxurious rooms are spectacular regardless of whether the target for 2100 is realistic or not.  According to Abibo, the company is considering the necessary arrangements for how a Martian city will operate independently and meet its needs.  Sitting next to a cliff allows expats to live in private homes and other parts of the city to be used for farming, animal husbandry and energy supply, such as the use of solar arrays.  The goal is to build a sustainable civilization on the surface of Mars that can survive without the need for continuous transportation with Earth.  However, there is no exact plan for how this idea will work.  It will certainly be a difficult path to follow.  Atmospheric pressure on Mars is 1% of Earth ’ s pressure, extremely cold temperatures and high cosmic radiation, so that any skin exposed to it would burn.  Alfredo Muñoz, founder of Abibo Architecture Studio, said: “We had to do a lot of research based on computation and working with scientists to figure out what kind of conditions we would face on Mars.  "Obviously, we have to face challenges that are completely specific to the conditions on Mars, and one of them is the activity in gravity of only a third of Earth's gravity."  Despite these challenges, there is fortunately carbon dioxide and water on the surface of Mars.  Munoz added, “Water is one of the great advantages we have on Mars and helps us get the right materials for construction.  "Basically, with water and carbon dioxide, we can make carbon, and with carbon, we can make steel."  In addition, efforts such as the production of oxygen from the Martian atmosphere, which was first carried out by the Mars rover's MAXI instrument, have raised hopes of a stable presence on Mars.  Abybo's plan is to use only Martian material to build the first Martian settlement.  The New City of Noah on Mars project is part of a larger science program organized by the Mars Society in collaboration with SONet, an international team of scientists and academics.  Munoz explained, “What we learn as we move on to develop a fully sustainable city on Mars will give us good ideas and insights about what we can do differently on Earth. ”  Many people are interested in a stable human presence on Mars.  From Carl Sagan to Robert Zubrin, to Mars enthusiast Elon Musk, to SpaceX CEO.  While some estimates by Elon Musk seem too ambitious, there is a growing consensus that any future city on Mars will eventually have to be self-sufficient.  Otherwise, the people on the Red Planet will never be independent of Earth. The Gustav Klimt's painting, "Portrait of a Lady," was stolen from the Ricci Oddi art gallery in Piacenza, Italy, in February 1997 [Source: 1]. 
The painting, which was valued at around £50 million, was part of the gallery's most valuable work [Source: 1].

The painting was discovered at the scene of the robbery, hidden behind a secret door in the wall of the gallery [Source: 1]. 
Workers found the painting wrapped in a black plastic bag, placed in a niche behind a partition [Source: 1]. 
The thieves had admitted to returning the artwork to the scene of the theft [Source: 1].

The painting was later recovered from the gallery in Piacenza, Italy, in December 2019 [Source: 6]. 
The discovery was made by an employee who was cleaning the walls of the gallery from ivy [Source: 6]. 
The painting was found hidden behind an iron door in the wall, along with a metal plate [Source: 6].

The authenticity of the painting was confirmed by experts, who studied the seals and stamps on the back of the canvas [Source: 6]. 
The painting was believed to be the original, and its value was estimated to be around 60 million euros [Source: 6].

The painting was created by Gustav Klimt in 1916 or 1917 [Source: 6]. 
It was part of the collection of the aristocrat Giuseppe Ricci Oddi, who bequeathed his collection to the city of Piacenza [Source: 6]. 
The painting was the most valuable exhibit of the Ricci Oddi Gallery [Source: 6].

Climate change is having a profound impact on agriculture worldwide. 
Rising temperatures are affecting crop yields and changing the growing conditions for various crops. 
According to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), the average global temperature has risen by about 1 degree Celsius since the late 19th century [Source: 1].

Temperature changes are affecting the growth and development of crops. 
Rising temperatures during the growing season are causing rice to be unable to pollinate, leading to reduced crop yields [Source: 2]. 
High temperatures and rainfall are also making the soil unable to maintain nutrients, reducing crop yields and increasing production costs [Source: 2].

Shifts in rainfall patterns are also affecting agriculture. 
In Latin America, where the region produces enough food to meet the needs of all its inhabitants, food prices remained high for a seventh consecutive month in the last month of 2020, with dairy products and vegetable oils driving the biggest price increases [Source: 1]. 
This is due to higher demand and weaker dollar values, but also exacerbated by the impact of the epidemic on the supply chain and the restriction of traffic [Source: 1].

Climate change is also affecting the growth of trees and corals, the abundance and geographical distribution of animal and plant species, the chemistry of oceans and lakes, and the accumulation of ice in cold areas [Source: 3]. 
These changes are a result of climate change, which is causing global temperature increases and uneven rainfall [Source: 3].

In addition, climate change is affecting the health and well-being of people, particularly vulnerable populations such as the elderly, children, and people in low-income communities [Source: 3]. 
The increase in temperature is also affecting the risk of diseases, such as dengue fever, which is expected to increase to 86% in Taiwan if the average temperature rises by 1 degree Celsius [Source: 2].

To mitigate the effects of climate change on agriculture, researchers from the University of Oxford suggest that modifying the way food is produced could be a good way to reduce global warming and climate change [Source: 7]. 
This includes replacing fossil fuels with environmentally friendly fuels and changing agricultural practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions [Source: 7].

Furthermore, climate change is affecting the land and its ability to absorb carbon. 
The land is often abused and contributes to the harm of climate change [Source: 10]. 
Global soils can currently absorb 1% of carbon, down from 7% in the past [Source: 10]. 
This is due to human behavior, which has changed the land from carbon capture to carbon release [Source: 10].

In conclusion, climate change is having a significant impact on agriculture worldwide. 
Rising temperatures, shifts in rainfall patterns, and changes in carbon dioxide levels are affecting crop yields, growing conditions, and the health and well-being of people. 
To mitigate these effects, researchers suggest modifying agricultural practices and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

The English Channel has become a significant route for refugees and asylum seekers attempting to cross into the United Kingdom, with many attempting to reach the British coast by small, unsafe boats [Source: 8].

According to recent reports, more than 7,400 people have attempted to cross the English Channel by small boats this year, nearly four times more than in 2019 [Source: 4]. 
The majority of these attempts have been made by Iranian nationals, with citizens of Afghanistan and Syria also attempting to cross the Channel [Source: 8].

Unfortunately, the attempts to cross the Channel have resulted in a significant number of casualties. 
In a recent incident, four asylum seekers, including two children, drowned in the English Channel [Source: 1]. 
The incident highlights the dangers faced by those attempting to cross the Channel in small, unsafe boats.

The casualty rate among those attempting to cross the Channel is a significant concern. 
In 2018, the death rate among migrants attempting to cross the English Channel was one death for every three people who reached Europe alive [Source: 6]. 
This highlights the need for increased efforts to prevent such incidents and ensure the safety of those attempting to cross the Channel.

If asylum seekers are successful in reaching the British side of the Channel, they are often met with a range of challenges. 
Many are taken into custody by the UK authorities, with some being held in detention centers [Source: 9]. 
The UK government has also implemented a range of measures to deter asylum seekers from attempting to cross the Channel, including increased patrols and searches [Source: 8].

In response to the growing number of asylum seekers attempting to cross the Channel, France has also increased its efforts to prevent such incidents. 
The French authorities have announced that they will be working more closely with the UK to prevent asylum seekers from attempting to cross the Channel [Source: 7]. 
The French government has also increased its own efforts to deter asylum seekers, including deploying more patrols and searching vessels [Source: 7].

In addition to the efforts of France and the UK, the European Union has also taken steps to address the issue of asylum seekers attempting to cross the English Channel. 
The EU has agreed to increase its efforts to support member states in preventing asylum seekers from attempting to cross the Channel [Source: 6]. 
The EU has also increased its funding for search and rescue operations in the Mediterranean, with the aim of reducing the number of asylum seekers attempting to cross the Channel [Source: 6].

The court ruling on claims filed against Iran's targeting of Ukrainian International Airlines flight PS 752 inside Iran's airspace has been a significant development in the case.

The court's ruling was based on the conclusion that the missile strikes on flight 752 were "deliberate" [Source: 1]. 


The judge, Edward Belobaba, found "on the basis of a balance of probabilities that the missile strikes on flight 752 were deliberate" [Source: 1]. 


The court also ruled that the plaintiffs had proved that the downing of the plane was based on state immunity laws, justice for victims of terrorist acts, and criminal law as "terrorist activity" [Source: 1].
